content:
Yes, conflicts and tensions between nations remain a persistent challenge in today's world. Although the global political landscape has shifted since World War I, many of the underlying factors that contribute to conflicts, such as nationalism, economic competition, and territorial disputes, continue to exist.

However, there have also been significant efforts to prevent and resolve conflicts through diplomacy, international cooperation, and multilateral institutions such as the United Nations. While conflicts and tensions may never fully disappear, there is hope that continued efforts towards peaceful resolution and cooperation can lead to a more stable and peaceful world.
